文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_004_chunk1
证据片段: The Hanford Site N Reactor core includes approximately 1000 Zircaloy-2 pressure tubes

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_004_chunk1
证据片段: coolant temperature increases from 204 to 282°C

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_004_chunk1
证据片段: waterside oxide layer thickness increases uniformly from ~3 μm to a maximum of over 50 μm

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_004_chunk1
证据片段: in-flux oxidation rates are clearly enhanced relative to ex-reactor Zircaloy oxidation rates

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_004_chunk2
证据片段: The waterside (inside diameter), oxide layer thickness increased uniformly from approximately 3 μm (the preinstallation value) at the inlet to a maximum of over 50 μm near the peak neutron flux location

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_004_chunk2
证据片段: The gas side (outer diameter) oxidation levels were about an order of magnitude less than the waterside oxidation

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_004_chunk2
证据片段: beyond ~2500 operating days (at oxide thicknesses greater than 15 to 20 μm, the oxidation and hydriding rates increased sharply

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_004_chunk2
证据片段: The azimuthal correction never exceeded 8°C (15°F), above or below average coolant temperature

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_004_chunk3
证据片段: the thin-film $( < 2 0 ~ \mu \mathrm { m } )$ regime

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_004_chunk3
证据片段: the thick-film $( > 2 0 ~ { \mu \mathrm { m } } )$ regime

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_004_chunk3
证据片段: the in-flux oxidation rate is definitely less than that of Hillner's correlation

证据片段: FIG. 5—Thick-film N reactor pressure tube oxidation data versus operating time and surface temperature

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_004_chunk4
证据片段: FIG. 6—N reactor Zircaloy pressure tube oxidation rates versus temperature: thin- and thick-film rates compared to Hillner's correlation of ex-reactor Zircaloy oxidation rates

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_004_chunk4
证据片段: thick-film rates are about 2 to 3 times greater

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_004_chunk4
证据片段: wall-average hydrogen content was determined by the inert-gas fusion method

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_004_chunk4
证据片段: very high (>500 ppm) hydrogen content in the innermost 20% of the wall

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_004_chunk4
证据片段: lower and relatively constant concentrations (50 to 100 ppm) throughout the remainder of the wall

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_004_chunk4
证据片段: hydrogen is building up significantly also in the 20 to 40% increment at the 12:00 position

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_004_chunk5
证据片段: an azimuthal hydrogen survey was performed at 9.17 m on Tube 5053 with an average value of 190 ppm

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_004_chunk6
证据片段: Thermal-hydraulic calculations have shown that plausible fuel element eccentricity within the tube can cause flow redistribution and azimuthal (bottom-to-top) temperature gradients of $1 7 \mathrm { { } ^ { \circ } C }$ EPY $( 6 3 ^ { \circ } \mathsf { F } )$ at the 9.14 to $9 . 3 7 ~ \mathrm { \ m }$ location

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_004_chunk6
证据片段: The observed maximum-to-minimum difference for Tube 1054 at $1 0 . 1 6 \mathrm { ~ m ~ }$ is $1 5 0 ~ \mathsf { p p m }$ (Fig. 8)

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_004_chunk6
证据片段: the oxidation rate and hydrogen accumulation rate both increase by a factor of 2 to 3 as oxide thicknesses exceed 15 to $2 0 ~ { \mu \mathrm { m } }$

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_004_chunk7
证据片段: Oxidation and deuterium uptake in Zr-2.5Nb pressure tubes are being monitored
